head.supplied: ¶ Doubtless it is desirable that all the institutions mentioned should be supplied, but the present edition is not extensive enough and would therefore need supplementing during the coming season. Th...

p.seg: Public Record Office, Victoria; Chief Secretary's Correspondence, E7989, with 87/J4465.

div.p:
To proof.
This letter was unformatted and the location entry is taken from typed details at the bottom of the letter.
The Hypercard says: This letter is written on. Arthur trans.
Doubtless it is desirable that all the institutions mentioned should be supplied, but the present edition is not extensive enough and would therefore need supplementing during the coming season. The suggestion of the hon the Chief Secretary to effect the transmission of this, the first fascicle, through members of Parliament would meet all present purposes, if each member was supplied with one copy, then the hon. Gentlemen might place it
it after them del. in that Library or Mechanic Institute which appears the most important in their District. I will therefore send in first instance copies for members of the Assembly as not a sufficient number is at present available for members also of the Council.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
13/7/74
This was typed at the bottom of the transcript: A note of 17.9.74 indicates that the 51 institutions in the list of Mechanics Institutes and Public Libraries marked by a cross have received a copy of the collection, and that 19 copies remain.
